conclusion: Analyze the motion of the block from point A to point B on the circular track, then to the conveyor belt, and finally to the point where the block slides past point B.
Determine the initial velocity of the block at point A as 0 since it is released from rest.
Calculate the distance AB using the radius of the circular track as 1.6 m.
Calculate the time taken for the block to slide from point A to point B as 0 seconds.
Conclude that the block reaches point B at rest since it slides in zero time.
Calculate the speed of the block at point B as 0 m/s.
Calculate the frictional force at point B as 0.8 N.
Calculate the normal force at point B as 8 N.
Calculate the supporting force at point B as 7.2 N.
Calculate the ratio of the supporting force to the gravitational force at point B as 0.9.
The speed of the block when it slides from point A to point B is 0 m/s, and the ratio of the supporting force to the gravitational force at point B is 0.9.
